ovdesc.p: EB.LOGGING.PARAMETER is used to define the way and the level of log
that should be recorded in EB.LOGGING application.

desc.p: This field contains brief description of the logging parameter file.
Up to 35 Characters.
Mandatory field.
This field contains the description of the logging parameter file.
Up to 35 Characters.
Mandatory field.
Key for EB.LOGGING.PARAMETER is a standard T24 alphanumeric field with 35 characters
This field defines the level of log that should be recorded.
can take values like INFO,FATAL,ERROR,TRACE,DEBUG
if we specify the level as INFO then all the logs which are of
levels greater than or equal to INFO need to get recorded.
The order goes as
INFO->TRACE->DEBUG->ERROR->CRITICAL
Mandatory field
This field specifies the way the log should be recorded.
Can take any of these possible values
DISK - This will record all log messages in EB.LOGGING
but on 'FATAL' records only fatal message.
ALWAYS - This will record all log messages in EB.LOGGING
even on 'FATAL'.
CONSOLE - This will display all the error message in screen
rather than recording in EB.LOGGING.
Mandatory field
